CARDINAL . The applicant lodged an appeal on points of law . Under Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Convention , she relied on PERSON ’s right to respect for her family life , submitting that it was in the child ’s interest for a legal parent - child relationship to be established between them , and that her inability to adopt PERSON entailed a disproportionate interference with her own family life . CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed her appeal on points of law :

CARDINAL . Adoption , emanating from classical NORP law , which based it on the “ imitation of nature ” ( the principle of adoptio naturam imitatur in the Institutes of PERSON ) creates , between the adopter and the adoptee , a legal relationship that is identical to that existing between parent and child . Although certain ORG make a distinction between several levels of adoption ( most often between full adoption and simple adoption ) , this characteristic is always present .

CARDINAL . Under NORP law adoption is prohibited ( haraam ) . However , the right is accorded a special institution : kafala or “ legal care ” . In GPE , with the exception of GPE , GPE and GPE , kafala is defined as a voluntary undertaking to provide for a child and take care of his or her welfare , education and protection .
CARDINAL . The procedural arrangements for establishing kafala depend on the domestic law of each NORP State . The relevant provisions of the NORP LAW thus read as follows :
“ Adoption ( tabanni ) is prohibited by the LAW and by legislation . ”

“ PERSON is an undertaking to assume responsibility for supporting , educating and protecting a minor child in the same manner as a father would care for his son . It is established by a legal act . ”
“ PERSON is granted upon appearance before the judge or notary , with the child ’s consent when he or she has a father and mother . ”

“ The holder of the right of kafala ( the kafil ) must be a NORP , a sensible and upright person , and be in a position to support the fostered child ( the makfoul ) , with the capacity to protect him or her . ”
“ The fostered child may be of known or unknown parentage . ”
“ The fostered child shall retain his or her original legal parent - child relationship if of known parentage . Otherwise , LAW shall be applied in respect of the child . ”

“ Should the father and mother , or CARDINAL of them , request the reinstatement under their guardianship of the fostered child , it will be for the child , provided he or she is of an age of discernment , to choose whether or not to return to his parents .
If the child is not of such an age , he may be returned only with the judge ’s authorisation , taking into account the interests of the fostered child . ”

CARDINAL . GPE Parties shall in accordance with their national laws ensure alternative care for such a child .

CARDINAL . Such care could include , inter alia , foster placement , ORG law , adoption , or if necessary placement in suitable institutions for the care of children .
